    • Constructor Detail

      • Distiller

        public Distiller()

    • Method Detail

      • setConfiguration

        protected static void setConfiguration(java.lang.String inputPath,
                    java.lang.String outputPath,
                    java.lang.String configPath,
                    java.lang.String localeString)
        Sets the basic configuration parameter for Distiller. It expects to find the configuration file Distiller4.config (UTF-8) in its user path. If the configuration file is absent you have to specify explicitly these parameters.
        Parameters:
        inputPath - location of the documents to be processed
        outputPath - location of the processed (annotated) files
        configPath - location of the specific configuration data for distiller, like names of months, patterns, etc.

      • readIdentifer

        protected static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> readIdentifer()
        Returns:
        HashMap containing the identifiers of the different sets (types) of documents. Returns null if the file cannot be found/read. Each key-value pair stands for the name you assigned to the document collection and the unique title that appears in each document of this collection. Example: authors-WIKIPEDIA

        Reads "identifier.config" (UTF-8)

      • setUpRegistry

        protected static void setUpRegistry()
        Sets key information for the document collection.
        • document registry: HashMap<String:unique identifier of this document collection, Document:the document itself>
        • identifier registry: HashMap<String:common name of the document collection, String:unique identifier of this document collection>

      • dispatchText

        protected static boolean dispatchText(java.lang.String fileName,
                   java.lang.String text)
        Fills the document registry. It takes each unique identifier as registered in the identifier register as Regular Expression and tries to identify it in the first section of the text (the first 10% of the text's characters. It matches with Regex parameters UNICODE_CASE and CASE_INSENSITIVE.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String file name of the document (required by Document)
        text - String content of the document
        Returns:
        true if the document could be assigned to a set of documents, i.e. it contained a unique title.

      • loadTextFiles

        protected static int loadTextFiles()
        Loads all files from the input path that end with one of the specified file extensions. fileCollection contains the loaded files.
        Returns:
        number of files loaded

      • loadSupportFiles

        protected static boolean loadSupportFiles()
        Loads auxiliary files such as month names etc.

        It loads the following files:

        • names of months
        • names of weekdays
        • numbers as words
        • file extensions of the documents to be handled.
        The file names must be specified in messages.properties.

        Returns:
        true if all files could be loaded.

      • loadPatterns

        protected static int loadPatterns()
        Loads all patterns.

        It reads the following patterns:

        • connector patterns (required)
        • basic named entities (required)
        • named entities (required)
        • word patterns (required)
        • location dependent patterns (optional)
        Returns:
        0 if all required patterns could be read correctly, otherwise -1.

      • readLines

        protected static java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> readLines(java.lang.String fileName)
        Reads data from a file (UTF-8) and removes all CR and LF.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String the name of the file (document) to be read
        Returns:
        Vector<String> of the lines of the file (document). If the file could not be read it returns null.

      • readText

        protected static java.lang.String readText(java.lang.String pathName)
        Reads data from a file (UTF-8) and removes all CR and LF.
        Parameters:
        pathName - String the name of the file (document) to be read
        Returns:
        String: the content of the document. If the file could not be read it returns null.

      • getPatternSet

        protected static PatternSet getPatternSet(java.lang.String docType,
                       java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> patternStrings)
        Returns the pattern set (four/five pattern groups) for a particular document collection.

        Each list of patterns has a general part (usually the first section of the file) and a document specific part. The specific part starts with >>> followed by the common name of the collection.

        Parameters:
        docType - String common name of the document collection.
        patternStrings - Vector<String> list of the patterns
        Returns:
        PatternSet: Set of patterns for this specific document collection. Returns null if the input pattern set does not contain data.
        See Also:
        PatternSet

      • init

        public static void init(java.lang.String inputDir,
        java.lang.String outputDir,
        java.lang.String configDir,
        java.lang.String localeString)
        Sets the environment for Distiller. It reads configuration files, auxiliary files, documents, and patterns. If any severe error occurs it stops Distiller.
        Parameters:
        inputDir - String input path (location of the documents to be processed, (optional, can be null, usually Distiller4.config has this information).
        outputDir - String output path (location for the annotated documents, optional, can be null, usually Distiller4.config has this information).
        configDir - String directory containing Distiller's configuration data, auxiliary files, and patterns (optional, can be null, usually Distiller4.config has this information).
        localeString - String locale (optional, can be null, usually Distiller4.config has this information)

      • annotateFiles

        public static java.util.Vector<Status> annotateFiles(java.util.Vector<Status> statusData)
        The annotation process handles all files registered in the document registry. It runs correctly when all environment parameters are set. Each annotation of a document runs in a separate thread.
        Parameters:
        statusData - Status - holds the information on the process state.
        Returns:
        Vector<Status> information on process results for all documents
        See Also:
        Status

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Runs Distiller. It sets up Distiller's environment and starts the annotation process. The annotation of each document runs in a separate thread.
        Parameters:
        args - input path, output path, configuration path, locale
